uk.ac.ncl.undergraduate.modules.csc3621.cryptanalysis.easyfreq

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ncl.undergraduate.modules.csc3621.cryptanalysis.easyfreq.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains generic methods that can be used throughout the implementation in all contexts.

    • Field Detail

      • OFFSET

        public static final int OFFSET
        Integer value for 'A', used as an offset to convert between characters and indexes. We assume the convention that A, B, ..., Z correspond to 0, 1, ..., 25 respectively. 'A' is the decimal constant 65 (0x41).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Util

        public Util()

    • Method Detail

      • readFileToBuffer

        public static java.lang.String readFileToBuffer(java.lang.String path)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads the whole content of a file in a String. It does not support large files (they will likely work slowly).
        Parameters:
        path - the file path to read from
        Returns:
        the content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - something goes wrong creating the file and/or reading from it

      • printBufferToFile

        public static void printBufferToFile(java.lang.String buffer,
                                     java.lang.String path)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Print a string to file.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the content to write into the file
        path - the file path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - something goes wrong creating the file and/or writing

      • charToIndex

        public static int charToIndex(char letter)
        You can use this method to find the index in the frequency table of the given character. It assumes the convention that A, B, ..., Z correspond to 0, 1, ..., 25 respectively.
        Parameters:
        letter - the letter to convert
        Returns:
        the index corresponding to the given letter

      • indexToChar

        public static char indexToChar(int index)
        You can use this method to find the character given an index of the frequency table. It assumes the convention that A, B, ..., Z correspond to 0, 1, ..., 25 respectively.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to convert
        Returns:
        the character corresponding to the given index

      • isValidLetter

        public static boolean isValidLetter(char letter)
        A letter is valid if it belongs to the English alphabet.
        Parameters:
        letter - the letter to check
        Returns:
        true if the letter belongs to the English alphabet.
